segment.source: Configuring Advanced Settings by Using Windows PowerShell
segment.target: Configuring Advanced Settings by Using Windows PowerShell

segment.source: Configuring Advanced Settings by Using Windows PowerShell
segment.target: Configuring Advanced Settings by Using Windows PowerShell

segment.source: Configuring Advanced Settings by Using Windows PowerShell
segment.target: Configuring Advanced Settings by Using Windows PowerShell

segment.source: The MED-V workspace package that you create includes a Windows PowerShell script (.ps1) file that you can edit before you test and deploy your MED-V workspace package.
segment.target: The MED-V workspace package that you create includes a Windows PowerShell script (.ps1) file that you can edit before you test and deploy your MED-V workspace package.

segment.source: This section provides information and guidance to help you manage MED-V configuration settings by using Windows PowerShell before you deploy the MED-V workspaces.
segment.target: This section provides information and guidance to help you manage MED-V configuration settings by using Windows PowerShell before you deploy the MED-V workspaces.

segment.source: Using Windows PowerShell Cmdlets in MED-V
segment.target: Using Windows PowerShell Cmdlets in MED-V

segment.source: The following Windows PowerShell cmdlets are available in Microsoft Enterprise Desktop Virtualization (MED-V) 2.0:
segment.target: The following Windows PowerShell cmdlets are available in Microsoft Enterprise Desktop Virtualization (MED-V) 2.0:

segment.source: New-MedvConfiguration
segment.target: New-MedvConfiguration

segment.source: Export-MedvConfiguration
segment.target: Export-MedvConfiguration

segment.source: New-MedvWorkspace
segment.target: New-MedvWorkspace

segment.source: Export-MedvWorkspace
segment.target: Export-MedvWorkspace

segment.source: To access Windows PowerShell cmdlets for MED-V, open Windows PowerShell and type the following command to import the MED-V modules.
segment.target: To access Windows PowerShell cmdlets for MED-V, open Windows PowerShell and type the following command to import the MED-V modules.

segment.source: After the modules are imported, you can access inline help for the cmdlets by using the standard Windows PowerShell Help commands, man or get-help.
segment.target: After the modules are imported, you can access inline help for the cmdlets by using the standard Windows PowerShell Help commands, man or get-help.

segment.source: For example, to access a description of the New-MedvConfiguration cmdlet including a complete list of available parameters, type the following command.
segment.target: For example, to access a description of the New-MedvConfiguration cmdlet including a complete list of available parameters, type the following command.

segment.source: You can also view help for specific parameters.
segment.target: You can also view help for specific parameters.

segment.source: For example, to view help for the parameter VmMemory, type the following:
segment.target: For example, to view help for the parameter VmMemory, type the following:

segment.source: To view a list of all MED-V configuration settings and their defaults, type the following command.
segment.target: To view a list of all MED-V configuration settings and their defaults, type the following command.

segment.source: To view a list of all MED-V configuration settings and their current values, type the following command.
segment.target: To view a list of all MED-V configuration settings and their current values, type the following command.

segment.source: Creating a MED-V Workspace with Custom Settings
segment.target: Creating a MED-V Workspace with Custom Settings

segment.source: After you successfully create a MED-V workspace package by using the MED-V Workspace Packager, a Windows PowerShell script is generated in the folder you specified for saving your packager files.
segment.target: After you successfully create a MED-V workspace package by using the MED-V Workspace Packager, a Windows PowerShell script is generated in the folder you specified for saving your packager files.

segment.source: The contents of this script show some of the available MED-V configuration settings that you can edit.
segment.target: The contents of this script show some of the available MED-V configuration settings that you can edit.

segment.source: Following these steps, you can customize the script and then run it in Windows PowerShell to create a MED-V workspace with the new settings.
segment.target: Following these steps, you can customize the script and then run it in Windows PowerShell to create a MED-V workspace with the new settings.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: Run Windows PowerShell with administrative credentials, and ensure that the Windows PowerShell execution policy allows the running of scripts.
segment.target: Run Windows PowerShell with administrative credentials, and ensure that the Windows PowerShell execution policy allows the running of scripts.

segment.source: Edit the Windows PowerShell script that was generated by the MED-V Workspace Packager, or author a new script with the configuration settings that you want.
segment.target: Edit the Windows PowerShell script that was generated by the MED-V Workspace Packager, or author a new script with the configuration settings that you want.

segment.source: Run Windows PowerShell with administrative credentials and at the command prompt, type the following command.
segment.target: Run Windows PowerShell with administrative credentials and at the command prompt, type the following command.

segment.source: This command runs the Windows PowerShell script and runs the New-MedvWorkspace cmdlet to generate a new MED-V workspace package.
segment.target: This command runs the Windows PowerShell script and runs the New-MedvWorkspace cmdlet to generate a new MED-V workspace package.

segment.source: The new packager files are saved in the folder that you originally specified for storing your MED-V Workspace Packager files.
segment.target: The new packager files are saved in the folder that you originally specified for storing your MED-V Workspace Packager files.

segment.source: For additional help about this cmdlet, see the Windows PowerShell Help.
segment.target: For additional help about this cmdlet, see the Windows PowerShell Help.

segment.source: Exporting a MED-V Configuration to a Registry File
segment.target: Exporting a MED-V Configuration to a Registry File

segment.source: You can update MED-V configuration settings after the MED-V workspace is installed.
segment.target: You can update MED-V configuration settings after the MED-V workspace is installed.

segment.source: Use the New-MedvConfiguration cmdlet to specify the parameters that you want to change.
segment.target: Use the New-MedvConfiguration cmdlet to specify the parameters that you want to change.

segment.source: For example, to create a registry file that changes the virtual machine memory setting, type the following commands.
segment.target: For example, to create a registry file that changes the virtual machine memory setting, type the following commands.

segment.source: You can import the resultant registry file from the host computer to a MED-V workspace to apply the new configuration settings.
segment.target: You can import the resultant registry file from the host computer to a MED-V workspace to apply the new configuration settings.
